revised_title: Observations on Apoplexy and Brain Obstruction
tldr: Dr. Archibald Adams describes the case of a patient who suffered from apoplexy due to an obstruction in the left ventricle of the brain. Despite the obstruction being in the left ventricle, the patient's right side was affected, and the left side had some remaining function. This observation challenges the author's initial opinion about the relationship between ventricle obstruction and corresponding side effects.
